title: (x) Art Deco 'Janice' - Selznick {Snoopy}
content:
[http://www.5d.cn/bbs/uploadFiles/2003-10/2814134518100.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051357/http:/www.5d.cn/bbs/uploadFiles/2003-10/2814134518100.jpg)   
 [http://www.abstractfonts.com/forum/attachment.php?s=&postid=3237](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051357/http:/www.abstractfonts.com/forum/attachment.php?s=&postid=3237)   
notice the upcase N ,there is a arc instead of a bar in the source sample.   
what's the typeface?
author: fontdj

comments.content:
could be ITC Anna Pro   
   
edit: Nope   
   
maybe it's the Image Club or URW? version...not sure where   
to view that.
It's not the Image Club version of ITC Anna. Ours matched the original (digital) ITC-supplied character set. No alternates like that.

Does [ITC Busorama Medium](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051357/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/itc-busorama/medium/testdrive.html?s=JANICE&p=36) have the right 'ingredients' to cobble up the oddball letters?

It looks like Selznick Normal by Nick Curtis. You can download it free [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051357/http:/www.moorstation.org/typoasis/designers/curtis/pages/s.htm)   
   
There's no previews on the site, but here's your sample:   
 ![Selznick](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518051357im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/20520.gif)
